paper_title.ja: ケイトは誰を愛したか--『鳩の翼』に潜むホモェロティックな欲望
paper_title.en: Whom does Kate love?: homoerotic desire concealed in The wings of the dove

description.ja: This paper argues The Wings of the Dove is a text that conceals homoerotic desire: Milly Theale's romance includes her love for Kate Croy and Kate, who calls Milly a dove, needs Milly's love. It discusses the same expressions used by different characters, the meanings of romance, the replaceability of points of view, and Milly's illness.First, we argue Milly's romance represents her desire for Kate. The replaceability of characters is implied when the same words or phrases are applied to or used by two characters. In the novel Milly is set up as a princess of a romance. Milly always regards...

paper_title.ja: Camp and subjectivity in Edward Albee's Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
paper_title.en: Camp and subjectivity in Edward Albee's Who's afraid of Virginia Woolf?

description.ja: Edward Albee's Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? is a play about two heterosexual couples, but it has a power to disquiet and disrupt hetero-normativity in family and sexuality. Many critics negatively point out closeted homosexuality in this play and they do not seem to reach the core of its connotation. The purpose of this paper is to argue the sexual radicalism implied in the play, using camp and subjectivity as keywords.This paper consists of four parts. The first two parts discuss how camp functions in the play with reference to double entendre and embedded structure. Then, in the last t...

paper_title.ja: Howard Overing SturgisのTimとBelchamberにおけるアセクシュアリティ
paper_title.en: ASEXUALITY IN HOWARD OVERING STURGIS'S TIM AND BELCHAMBER

description.ja: This paper argues that asexuality of the protagonists is the crucial element that drives Howard Overing Sturgis's novels, Tim (1891) and Belchamber (1904). The heroes and heroines in the late nineteenth century cannot deviate from the role models that "compulsory heterosexuality" imposes upon them. Sturgis's protagonists do not seemingly belong to the figure. However, they must develop their character under the pressure of the compulsory heterosexuality. Their asexuality does not provide them with other choices, which causes their tragedy. Tim, the protagonist of Tim, is a boy who loves onl...

paper_title.ja: 『タイピー』におけるホモエロティックな視線

description.ja: Herman Melville's Typee (1846), describing his experience in the South Seas, was published as a work of authentic travel writing. Travel writing in the early nineteenth century could provide "American readers with voyeuristic 'peeps' into foreign lands unrestricted by American social and sexual codes" "under the guise of scientific observation" and be regarded as "a possible Victorian form of genteel pornography." My supposition is that Melville provides a homoerotic gaze on the male body under the disguise of travel writing; he identifies the gaze with that of a bachelor; and he refuses/re...
description.en: Herman Melville's Typee (1846), describing his experience in the South Seas, was published as a work of authentic travel writing. Travel writing in the early nineteenth century could provide "American readers with voyeuristic 'peeps' into foreign lands unrestricted by American social and sexual codes" "under the guise of scientific observation" and be regarded as "a possible Victorian form of genteel pornography." My supposition is that Melville provides a homoerotic gaze on the male body under the disguise of travel writing; he identifies the gaze with that of a bachelor; and he refuses/refutes the matrimonial system in Western society at that time. In the first part, we discuss how Typee provides a framework of colonial discourse of eroticism between white males and indigenous females, using the erotic nudity of an indigenous beauty, Fayaway, and her romantic relationship with the narrator, Tommo. Then, the framework is analyzed, which leads us to the mechanism of disguising homoerotic desire. Jealous relationships between two male pairs including the narrator give us a clue to help with the analysis. In the second part, we discuss the homoerotic desire that is derived from the narrator whose gaze is identified with that of a bachelor in the Typee valley. The happiness in the valley is provided through a system of taboos. The "Ti," which reminds the narrator of "a sort of Bachelor's Hall," is situated at the top of the system and Mehevi, "a confirmed bachelor," is the chief of the "Ti" as well as of the tribe. "Fraternal feeling" in the "Ti," therefore, provides a "spirit of unanimity" to all the inhabitants and enables them to live in the "Happy Valley." It comes home to the narrator who identifies himself with the bachelor in the "Ti" that the happiness is in opposition to the unhappiness caused by the matrimonial system in which the narrator has situated himself. In conclusion, we know that in Typee Melville refuses/refutes the violence of the Western matrimonial system that was imposed on sexuality.

paper_title.ja: 世紀転換期のホモエロティックな視点 : Henry Blake Fuller, Bertram Cope's Yearから見える世界
paper_title.en: HOMOEROTIC GAZE IN THE TURN OF THE CENTURY : A WORLD SEEN THROUGH HENRY BLAKE FULLER'S BERTRAM COPE'S YEAR

description.ja: The purpose of this paper is to reevaluate the place of Henry Blake Fuller's Bertram Cope's Year (1919) in the critical appraisal. Analysis of the connection between marriage and the erotic triangle as a literary device in the novel will lead us to the reevaluation. This will then be reinforced by an exploration into the hidden tradition of the device. The device was contrived to express covertly but ingeniously the homoerotic desire that still had to be closeted at the time when Fuller published the novel. In order to prove it, the use of such words as "Sappho" and "Urania" is pointed out ...

research_project_title.ja: アメリカ文学におけるホモエロティックな欲望のインターテクスチュアリティ研究
research_project_title.en: A Study of Intertextuality of Homoerotic Desire in American Literature

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

description.ja: 20世紀中盤に活躍した一群のアメリカのゲイ作家たちは相互に交友関係を持つが、彼らのテクストにもインターテクスチュアルな関係がある。その関係を考察することで、ホモセクシュアリティが可視化する時代にホモエロティックな欲望がどのようにテクストに埋め込まれているかを解明する。この目的のために、ゴア・ヴィダル、トルーマン・カポーティ、ジェイムス・ボールドウィン、クリストファー・イシャーウッドおよびテネシー・ウィリアムズの原稿などのコレクションを持っている図書館で調査および資料収集を行い、関係を考察するための見取り図を作成した。
description.en: A group of American gay writers of the mid twentieth-century had the interaction among them, so their texts also have intertextual relationships. By considering the relationships, the way how homoerotic desire has been embedded in their texts in the age of homosexuality becoming open will be explicated. For the purpose, the manuscripts of Gore Vidal, Truman Capote, James Baldwin, Christopher Isherwood, and Tennessee Williams have been researched in their special collections and the materials have been collected, which enabled me to make a blue-print of the relationships.

research_project_title.ja: アメリカ文学に見られる解放と隠蔽のテーマと同性愛の研究

description.ja:
本年度の研究、C.B.ブラウンを中心に行う予定であったが、種々の事情から、トル-マン・カボ-テイ及びマ-ガレット・ミッチェルに切り替えざるを得ず、当初の予定から多少の軌道修正を余儀なくされた。それ故、ブラウン作品スキャナーで読みとり、言葉を拾う作業は次年度以降に持ち越すことになった。
本年度に行った研究は、まずOEDを中心とする辞書や、すでに発売されている文学作品CD-ROMなどから、同性愛に関連する言葉を集めることであった。まず、OEDのテキストに同性愛という言葉を含む項目を探し、その項目及び引用をを拾い集めた。それを基に、同性愛と関連して用いられる言葉もリストアップし始めている。また辞書で拾った言葉を基に、文学作品のCD-ROMから、引用例を拾い集める作業も開始している。
十分な時間を取ることができず、また明確に同性愛を表す言葉であると実証するのが困難な場合も多く、当初予定していたコンコーダンスは、現在作成中ではあるが、完成には至らなかった。ただし、思ったより多くの言葉を拾っていくことができそうである。またこの作業を通じて得た言葉に対する感覚が、カポ-テイやミィチェルの研究における隠蔽と解放の問題を扱う際、大いに役に立ったと確信している。

research_project_title.ja: 性の問題と文学的想像力に関する研究

research_project_title.en: Study on Gender, sexuality and Literary Imagination
